events.name: Joint Meetup (with Cloud Native + Container Devs) - Containers/K8S/Serverless

venue.name: Google India Pvt. Ltd
venue.address_1: No. 3, RMZ Infinity - Tower E 4th Floor Old Madras Road Bangalore, 560 016 Landmark: Opposite Gopalan Signature Mall

events.description:
This is a joint meetup with "Cloud Native" and "Container Developers" group.

The meetup is focused on Server-less (Cloud Functions), So we will be having a talk on Server-less/Cloud Functions followed by Hands-On-Lab. Target Audience are "Beginners", so basic understanding of Containers are the only prerequisite.

We also have a special talk from "Hasura" about their "GraphQL Engine".

Agenda:
------------
9:00-9:30 : Registration

9:30-10:15 : A blazing-fast, highly scalable application with GraphQL, Kubernetes and Serverless (cloud functions) using Hasura by Tanmai Gopal (Co-Founder, Hasura.io)

10:15-11:00 : Introduction to Serverless and Google Cloud Functions by Malepati Bala Siva Sai Akhil (Technical Project Leader, Huawei)

11:00-11:15 : Break
11:15-1:00 : Hands-On-Lab

Important Note:
----------------------
Since we have limited seats for Hands-on-Lab, RSVP on this meetup doesn't guarantee the seat, please fill this Google Form and submit.

https://goo.gl/forms/YzZwtUUyMxnWhOA23

Last date for RSVP & Google Form Submission is 09th July. Seat Confirmation will be notified by 10th July through Email.

Also Please bring your Laptop for "Hands-On-Lab"

Prerequisite:
------------------
Basic understanding of Containers.

(Visit http://gdgbangalore.com for updates)

Google Cloud Developer Community (GCDC), Google Developers Group (GDG) and Women Tech Makers (WTM) Bangalore are proud to announce the DevFest Bangalore 2019 which is the biggest Google related event in Bangalore by GDG community!
The event is set to take place on September 21st and 22nd 2019.

DevFest is large, community -run events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google technologies. The speakers and the content are carefully curated matching the set standards of the tech era.

This year’s DevFest will be a gala for the developer community. It will consist of activities catering to the professional and the lateral crowd.

i. Speaker Sessions
ii. Workshops
iii. Pannel Discussions
iv. Startup connect

events.name: Meetup #10 - Architecture Focus on GCP
events.description:
** For working professionals ONLY. Students NOT allowed **

-- This is a FREE meetup --
Please DO NOT RSVP at the meetup page, instead fill this form - https://forms.gle/fGhBmjtBBQrxTNbS7 - to help us plan for better logistics

We're super excited to host a special meetup focused around GCP architecture.

Our first speaker is Kevin Nelson, who is a Staff Developer Advocate on GCP (expertise on Architecture and SAP integration) based out of Los Angeles. His session would focus around generic GCP architecture and as to what makes GCP different (and hopefully interesting) compared to other cloud providers. The session would also expand upon CloudRun which is a great new service with broad applications. Talk would conclude with a session on AutoML which will be a fun talk that shows how developers can build custom machine learning models without having to become Machine Learning and TensorFlow experts

Our second speaker of the day is Sathish VJ who has all the GCP technical certifications under his belt. The focus of his talk would be to provide the required tips and tricks to prepare for the Professional Cloud Architect (PCA) certification exam.

Here's the tentative agenda:
9:30 AM - 10:00 AM : Welcome and Registration
10:00 AM - 11:30 AM : Session by Kevin Nelson
11:30 AM - 11:45 AM : Q & A
11:45 AM - 12:30 PM : Session by Sathish VJ
12:30 PM - 01:00 PM : Snacks/Refreshments/Networking

events.name: Meetup #11 - Data engineering on GCP

venue.name: 91 springboard
venue.address_1: ITPL Main Road, Mahadevapura 5th floor, Trifecta Adatto, 21, ITPL Main Rd

events.description:
** For working professionals only. Students are not allowed**

--This is a FREE meetup--
Please DO NOT RSVP at the meetup page, instead fill this form-
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd8Pyu2xu7I-d62gCRGtfBcmZlBaNliK7QNIFffTn1awNWxng/viewform
to help us plan for better logistics.

9:30 AM - 10:00 AM Registration

10:00 AM - 10:45 AM "AI/ML for assessing the quality of doctor consultations"
By Pranjal Aswani, Data Engineer at Halodoc.

10:45 AM - 11:30 AM "Deep Transfer Learning with Real-World Case Studies" By Dipanjan Sarkar, GDE in ML.

11:30 AM - 12:15 PM “Building the data story with the power of Graph Analytics and Visualization”
By Karthic Rao, GDE in ML

12:15 PM - 12:30 PM Break/Networking

Pranjal Aswani:
Pranjal Aswani is a Data Engineer at Halodoc where he has worked on a few of the challenging problems that we solve, ranging from developing and maintaining backend systems to assessing the quality of consultations to how to deal with data in general and so on.
He was a GSoC 18 student for CHAOSS and a mentor in 2019 for the same org. He interned with Dunzo and NII and graduated from Mumbai University in 2018.

Dipanjan Sarkar:
Dipanjan (DJ) Sarkar is a Data Science Lead at Applied Materials, leading advanced analytics efforts around computer vision, natural language processing and deep learning. He is also a Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning. He has consulted and worked with several startups as well as Fortune 500 companies like Intel and Open Source organizations like Red Hat.

Karthik’s Talk:
In this talk, let's explore the power of Graph analytics on large datasets powered by Dgraph running on Google Kubernetes Engine.
Along with it, we'll also explore the recipes for running a stateful workload on GKE or K8's in general.

Dgraph is an open-source, distributed, native GraphDB built for scale and speed.
Let's build the story from the data as we together dig in, explore and visualize the data using the intuitive graph querying and distributed graph processing capabilities of Dgraph.

events.name: GCP Anthos - Application Modernization Platform
events.description:
** IMP Note **
1. This will be an online event available on Google Hangouts Meet (https://meet.google.com/gad-yamj-qry)
2. A Slack channel will be shared to join and answer questions with the speaker in real-time as the session happens

Topic:
Anthos is GCP’s hybrid/multi-cloud platform launched close to 2 years back. Anthos is a software based solution that allows enterprises to modernize their application stack in any environment including Onprem, GCP or in any other public cloud. In this talk, I will provide an overview of Anthos platform that will cover use cases, architecture and the ecosystem around Anthos. I will also walk through an Anthos demo showcasing key features of Anthos.

Speaker: Sreenivas Makam, Hybrid cloud specialist, Google

Bio:
In his current role at Google, Sreenivas is a hybrid cloud specialist architecting solutions for Google cloud customers. Prior to Google, Sreenivas had worked in Cisco Systems and a bunch of startups. Sreenivas has a strong background in infrastructure, networking, cloud and containers. He is an active speaker at conferences and meetup groups. Sreenivas has been a Docker captain for 2.5 years. He is an active blogger in the cloud and containers domain and he has also written a book on CoreOS and Containers.

events.name: Google Cloud Security - Secrets Manager & IAM Roles
events.description:
** IMP Note **
1. This will be a LIVE online session on Google Hangouts Meet
2. A Slack channel (#meetup on https://gdgcblr.slack.com) will be available to join and ask questions with the speaker which will be taken up and answered at the end

Topic:
Security is everyone's responsibility and with massive digital transformation that just happened "overnight" being remote is the new normal. Increasing number of workloads are being migrated to the cloud and who doesn't want to be secure in the cloud.
In this security focused session we dive deep about secrets manager and importance of IAM roles.

Here's the brief agenda:
Mins 0-20 - Discussion about the security features in GCP and overview of Secrets Manager.
Mins 21-30 - Demo on IAM Roles Management in GCP.
Mins 31-50 - Live Demo on Secrets Manager in GCP.

Participants are requested to join our slack workspace - https://gdgcblr.slack.com - and the channel #meetup to ask questions for the speaker which will be taken up at the end of the session.

Speaker profile:
Praveen Thirumurugan, SDE at Caterpillar Inc. (Organizer - GDG Cloud Coimbatore)
LinkedIn - https://linkedin.com/in/thirupraveen18
Twitter - https://twitter.com/praveentcom

events.name: Serverless solutions using Google Cloud Functions
events.description:
** IMP Note **
1. This will be a LIVE online session on Google Hangouts Meet
2. A Slack channel (#meetup) on our workspace (https://join.slack.com/t/gdgcblr/shared_invite/zt-dkjf6cf5-Py1_SkQL0RN1oiEwO2IyaA) will be available to join and ask questions with the speaker which will be taken up and answered at the end

Serverless computing is a cloud computing execution model in which the cloud provider runs the server and dynamically manages the allocation of resources. Google Cloud Functions is a serverless, event-driven computing service within Google Cloud Platform where developers can use it to create and implement programmatic functions without having to handle the overhead of provisioning the underlying cloud infrastructure such as servers, storage, and other resources. Let's deep dive to leverage the benefits of serverless computing using Google Cloud Functions.

Agenda:
1) Serverless computing
2) Google Cloud Functions
3) Best practices
4) Use cases
5) Live demo

Participants are requested to join our slack workspace - https://join.slack.com/t/gdgcblr/shared_invite/zt-dkjf6cf5-Py1_SkQL0RN1oiEwO2IyaA - and the channel #meetup to ask questions for the speaker which will be taken up at the end of the session.

Speaker profile:
Anil Saravade
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anilgsaravade/

upcoming.name: Leveraging PVMs on GKE to save costs while avoiding downtime
upcoming.description:
*** IMP Note ***
1. This will be a LIVE online session on Google Hangouts Meet
2. Request attendees to maintain courtesy of an online session and mute your microphones before joining and during the call
2. A Slack channel (#meetup) on our workspace (https://join.slack.com/t/gdgcblr/shared_invite/zt-dkjf6cf5-Py1_SkQL0RN1oiEwO2IyaA) will be available to join and ask questions with the speaker that will be taken up at the end of the session
*****************

Pre-emptible VMs are machines which are up to 80% cheaper than their equivalent machine types as On Demand mode. However, they do come with several challenges and caveats with respect to their availability and reliability.
In this session, we will learn how to utilize PVMs, i.e, pre-emptible nodes, on Google Kubernetes Engine to get the full benefit of the reduced costs without having to compromise on availability and reliability by using some neat tips and tricks that we've learnt from past experiences.

Speaker profile:
Alfred Tommy
